messages.text:
```/* Another evil option when it comes to compiling the C library is
   --ffast-math since it alters the ABI.  */
#if defined __FAST_MATH__ && !defined TEST_FAST_MATH
# error "glibc must not be compiled with -ffast-math"
#endif```
:til:: also glibc calls `--ffast-math` evil

messages.text:
Alright, someone stop me from doing something beastly:
I'm trying to make a jll for the following repo (cc <@U67BJLYCS>)
<https://github.com/google/souper>

1. It has 3 other git repos as dependencies - z3, llvm, and alive2.
2. There is a build script in the repo that will download and build z3 and llvm, but I think that is incredible overkill.
3. I don't know how to apply the compiler flags if I choose to customize the builds myself as the wizard suggests.
any BinaryBuilder elves wanna help out with a Christmas miracle? (jk, you have better things to do, enjoy your holidays)

elements.text:

messages.text: Julia v1.6 doesn’t build cleanly on aarch64 darwin yet.  I believe the next hurdle is to get a PCRE patch that Keno submitted to an upstream dependency of PCRE (to avoid a crash) but we’re not certain if PCRE has released a version with that update dependency yet
